question.body: B cells are capable of making antibody when exposed directly to an antigen. However, the process works better if the antigen is presented to the B cell by another cell that also expresses the correct MHC proteins. What could the antigen presenting cells be?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Cytotoxic T cells kill pathogens or abnormal somatic cells.
Incorrect. Dendritic cells are involved with the innate response.
Incorrect. Macrophages may present antigen but the do not present it to B cells.
Correct. Helper T cells boost the naive B cell response to an antigen.

multiple_choice.choice: T cells and B cells which have become specialized for antigenic response live forever.
Our brain remembers what we have encountered before and tells the cells of the immune system what to do.
When your immune system encounters a new antigen in addition to creating effector cells it also creates some memory cells which are capable of clonal expansion at a later time.
We maintain circulating levels of antibodies against every antigen we have ever encountered.

response.feedback: Incorrect. T and B cells do not live forever although memory cells may live for years.
Incorrect. You brain does not become involved in your immune response.
Correct. Part of an initial immune reaction is to create memory cells which can respond upon later exposure to the same antigen.

question.body: Cytotoxic T cells and NK cells both result in the death of a cell the body may find threatening. What is the biggest difference?

multiple_choice.choice: NK cells are found in your body and Cytotoxic T cells come from transplants.
Cytotoxic T cells are part of cell-mediated immunity and work on pathogen infected cells. NK cells are believed to be part of tumor surveillance.
Necrotic cell death happens with Cytotoxic T cells.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Cytotoxic T cells are part of your normal immune arsenal.
Correct. Both cells pick up cells that have abnormal markers on their cells surfaces, but they seem to be targeting different types of markers.
Incorrect. Cytotoxic T cells are capable of initiating a controlled sequence of events in the cell which result in cell death.
